name: Peak Machinery
description:
Peak Machinery
Unlock Mekanism's multiblocks, the Laser Drill, the Rainbow Generator, Ender Utilities, AND ME autocrafting in this packed chapter.

Also unlock a cardboard box.

quests.name: Not framed: filtered
quests.description:
Craft a Filter Upgrade!

These can be used in an Electric Pump to produce Heavy Water which is used in the creation of Deuterium, a fuel for the Fusion Reactor!

quests.name: It's out of this world!
quests.description: Go universal and craft some Cosmic Alloy!

quests.name: Coated with pearls
quests.description:
Soul Vial but even better.
Make an Ender Lasso.

quests.name: Preparing for the winter
quests.description: Craft the Resistive Heater to turn energy into heat! This machine is required to provide heat for the Thermoelectric Boiler multiblock.

quests.name: TEPid Brine!
quests.description:
Make the Thermal Evaporation Plant multiblock to get some Brine!

To make the multiblock, build a 4x4x3 cube of the Thermal Evaportaion Blocks but leave the middle and top 3 block empty so you form a bucket shape. This is the minimum size of the multiblock but it can be as tall as 18 blocks!

The Thermal Evaporation Valve and Thermal Evaporation Controller can be place on any side of the multiblock, as long as it's not in a corner.

Water can be pumped into the multiblock through a valve and to extract the brine you will need another valve to do so.

The temperature inside the multiblock depends on the biome you're in, so if you're in a snow biome, your productivity will be lower than if you were in a desert.

quests.name: Even more generators!
quests.description:
Craft even more generators!

You also need to be careful with some of these.
The Explosive Generator will, you guessed it, explode continuously while active, causing massive damage to anyone nearby. These explosions will not destroy the surrounding blocks.

The Halitosis Generator is also a nasty piece of work. It will spawn Ender Mites randomly while active, so watch out for those!

quests.name: The Scientific ______
quests.description: Mesh your Iridium with your Osmium to make Osmiridium, and then trial and error it into a Methodology Processor.

quests.name: No dirt allowed!
quests.description:
Craft a Chemical Dissolution Chamber and a Chemical Washer to make slurries of your ores and get rid of all their impurities!

This will allow you to get 5 times the ingots from an ore!

quests.name: Hope you aren't ticklish
quests.description:
A Handy Bag can store items based on its card size in each of its 27 slots.
Requires a memory card to function.
Can hold 4 memory cards.

quests.name: Terra Shatterer
quests.description: The Infinity Drill uses 10,000 RF or 3mb Biofuel per block broken. At first, it can only mine a 1x1x1 area, but as the drill stores more and more power, it levels up and can mine increasingly large amounts of terrain. Shift rightclick to cycle through the sizes.

quests.name: Almost Google!
quests.description: The Interface Terminal allows you to see the inventories of all of your ME Interfaces in one UI.

quests.name: FINALLY! AUTOMATION!!!
quests.description: The ME Interface allows for automating patterns, which can be used in conjunction with Molecular Assemblers or any other way of processing items, such as smelting.

quests.name: Fluids. All the Fluids.
quests.description: The fluid interface allows multiple fluid imports and exports into the system.

quests.name: Drawn with crayon
quests.description: Blank Patterns can be converted into Patterns for a specific process (crafting or otherwise) through the Pattern Terminal. Placing them in an ME Interface will allow your system to do this process on demand.

quests.name: And now: Factorio
quests.description:
Most Mekanism machines have multiple tiers. Higher tiers are called factories, and have a greater number of slots to for it to be processed.
Tier 1 has 1 slot
Tier 2 has 3 slots
Tier 3 has 5 slots
Tier 4 has 7 slots

quests.name: Over here, over there
quests.description:
Ender Chests can be used to transmit items across dimensions and any amount of space.
Sync them by using the same dyes on them, and make them private with a diamond.

quests.name: Red Rice Red Rice
quests.description:
Craft 4 Steaming Redstonia Crystals in the Pressurized Reaction Chamber. You'll get Steam from your Thermoelectric Boiler multiblock and DT-Fuel by combining Deuterium and Tricium. Don't forget: You can obtain Deuterium by using an Electric Pump on Water with a Filter Upgrade, and Tricium from Lithium using a Solar Neutron Activator. Be aware that Steam is considered as a liquid, while DT-Fuel as a gas.
I would recommend automating each step of this process as best as you can.

quests.name: Wait thats a wildfire - run!
quests.description: Active an Advanced End Core by right-clicking on an End Crystal in The End.

quests.name: Mob Imprisionment Tool
quests.description:
Right click on a mob to pick it up.
Requires a Memory Card Module.

quests.name: All the Range
quests.description:
Kids these days, always going "but I need better connectivity" and "I need to use my Wireless Terminal outside the house" - back in my day, we used a payphone and were SATISFIED!
Hmph

quests.name: Goodbye spacetime!
quests.description: Contains 9 slots of near-infinite storage. Middle click to keep that slot that item.

quests.name: In-and-Out World
quests.description:
Using the Spatial IO Port, you can "capture" and "deploy" areas of the world. The area you capture is limited by the size of your Spatial Storage Cell, and defined by a cuboid structure around the area you want and made up of Spatial Pylons.
Note: Both the Spatial IO Port and Spatial Pylons must be in the same network.

quests.name: Campfire
quests.description:
Right-clicking on an End Crystal in The End will convert an Inactive Ender Core into an Active Ender Core.
There are 3 different tiers of Ender Core. Craft an Advanced.

quests.name: Items items everywhere
quests.description:
Ender Pouches can be used to transmit items across dimensions and any amount of space.
Sync them by using the same dyes on them, and make them private with a diamond.
Ender Pouches use the same system as the Ender Chest, and when shift right-clicking on one, copy its dyes.

quests.name: Generations of generators
quests.description:
Craft some generators!

Be careful though, the Netherstar Generator will give you the Wither II debuff if you're nearby while it's running and the Death Generator will give you a 1 minute bebuff that will KILL you when it runs out!

quests.name: Careful with the spikes!
quests.description:
Craft the Ender Porcupine and access your blocks and items wirelessly!

Acts similarly to AA's Phantomfaces and consumes 1 GP per block away from the block being wirelessly accessed.

quests.name: Torch
quests.description:
Right-clicking on an End Crystal in The End will convert an Inactive Ender Core into an Active Ender Core.
There are 3 different tiers of Ender Core. Craft an Enhanced.

quests.name: A few bytes
quests.description: Memory Card (items) 6 B allows inventory slots to hold 64 items.

quests.name: Time to use your brine!
quests.description:
Craft 4 Lithium Dust!

This can be done by putting brine in the Thermal Evaporation Plant instead of water.

The result of this is Liquid Lithium which you will then have to decondensentrate with the Rotary Condensentrator to make it a gas.

You then need to run the Litium gas through a Chemical Crystallizer to get Lithium Dust.

quests.name: Wireless Systems
quests.description: Will allow a Wireless Terminal that is linked to your ME network through a Security Terminal to access the network.

quests.name: Drill, baby, drill!
quests.description:
Craft a Laser Base and 4 Laser Drills and start drilling for some valuable ores!

Place the Laser Base anywhere, it does NOT have to "see" bedrock. Place the 4 Laser Drills 1 block away on each side of the Laser Base with the back towards the Laser Base.

Laser Lenses can be used to increase or decrease the chances of getting specific ores!

quests.name: Your passport past Mine
quests.description: The Crafting Card can be placed in Export Buses to allow it to request items to be crafted from your system. It can also be used in Interfaces for much the same purpose, and can also be used in Level Emiters to detect when an item is being crafted.

quests.name: Boring, Bland, Basic
quests.description: Alloy up a few Ender Alloy (Basic).

quests.name: Applied Autocrafting
quests.description: The Molecular Assembler can autocraft recipes for your AE2 system if adjacent to an ME Interface with the a pattern inside of it.

quests.name: Pearly Power
quests.description: One of the few ways to charge your Ender Capacitors, the Ender Infuser consumes Ender Pearls to give 1000 charge and Eyes of Ender to give 2000 charge.

quests.name: Don't be dumb, make a drum
quests.description: Craft a Demonically Garganguan Drum. It stores 65,536 buckets of fluid.

quests.name: Wand of WALL OF TEXT
quests.description:
Make a Wand of the Lazy Builder. And then have a brain aneurysm trying to read and comprehend what it can do.

Sorry about that.

quests.name: ALL the generators!!
quests.description:
Craft the last generators from Extra Utilities 2!

The only effect among these generators is the Frosty Generator putting snow onto the ground.

quests.name: Pot of gold, please
quests.description: Craft a Rainbow Block using the Resonator while the Rainbow Generator is running.

quests.name: Enchanted Wands
quests.description: The Builders Wand and the Destruction Wand are unbreakable.

quests.name: Fluid there, fluid here
quests.description:
Ender Fluid tanks can be used to transmit fluids across dimensions and any amount of space.
Sync them by using the same dyes on them, and make them private with a diamond.

quests.name: Constructing more pylons
quests.description:
Used in conjunction with the Spatial IO Port to "capture" and "deploy" areas of the world. Place the Spatial Pylons as the rim of a cuboid stucture, surrounding the area you want to capture.
This means a 3x3x3 structure will capture the one block inside it.
If assembled properly, the Spatial Pylons with glow purple.

quests.name: Crayon holder
quests.description: In this you can convert Blank Patterns into Patterns for a specific item. Click the button below the scroll bar to toggle the pattern mode between Crafting and Processing.

quests.name: Say "NO" to teleportation
quests.description: The Ender Inhibitor prevents Endermen or other similar entities from teleporting while within its radius - a must-have for a mob farm.

quests.name: Drill it into your brain!
quests.description: Craft a White Laser Lens for your Laser Drill and start drilling for some Iridium!

quests.name: Watch your baby work
quests.description:
The Crafting CPU is a multiblock made up of at least one Crafting Storage (of any size), and is a cuboid shape that can contain Crafting Storages, Crafting Monitors, and Crafting Co-Processing Units.
The Crafting Monitor will allow you to track the progress of the top level item the multiblock is crafting.

quests.name: 2^3 Spatial Component
quests.description: Stores up to a 2x2x2 area as a cell.

quests.name: Crafting Unit
quests.description:
The Crafting CPU is a multiblock made up of at least one Crafting Storage (of any size), and is a cuboid shape that can contain Crafting Storages, Crafting Monitors, and Crafting Co-Processing Units.
The Crafting Co-Processing Units increase the number of simultaneous crafting orders your multiblock can do.

quests.name: 128^3 Spatial Component
quests.description: Stores up to a 128x128x128 area as a cell.

quests.name: Many fingers
quests.description:
A Handy Chest (Large) can store items based on its card size in each of its 54 slots.
Requires a memory card to function.
Can hold 4 memory cards.

quests.name: Synonym1, uh oh code broke
quests.description: Alloy up a few Ender Alloy (Advanced).

quests.name: It's all digital!
quests.description:
Craft a Digital Miner!

In the GUI of this block you will find a config button where you can specify radius up to the max of 32 and between what y-levels you want it to mine on.

You will also need to tell the Digital Miner what to mine by adding a filter in the GUI.

quests.name: FUSION HAAAA!
quests.description: Craft the Chemical Infuser and infuse away!

quests.name: Clear as Crystal
quests.description: Crystals are frequently used as modules. Install them through the Tool Workstation.

quests.name: Charged Cyan
quests.description: Able to hold a maximum charge of 500,000, the Ender Capacitor (Advanced) is the final tier of Ender Utilities power capacitors.

quests.name: Link your Quantums
quests.description:
To make a Quantum Bridge, you need to have two locations that have a ME Quantum Link Chamber surrounded by a ring of 8 ME Quantum Rings.
Then, you need to place bound Quantum Entangled Singularies inside both of them. A pair of Quantum Entangled Singularies are created by causing an explosion near an Ender Dust and a Singularity.
Once you have all of this, both sides need to be powered, and only then will your network connect to both sides, and even then only for as long as both sides are chunkloaded.


Or just run spaghetti cables everywhere, its your base not mine!

quests.name: Extravagant, Enchanced
quests.description: Alloy up a few Ender Alloy (Enhanced).

quests.name: Always been bits
quests.description:
Memory Card (items) 12 B allows inventory slots to hold 4096 items.


No thats not overpowered, why would you ask that?

quests.name: Basically, it's pretty hot.
quests.description: Craft 6 Basic Thermodynamic Conductors.

quests.name: All Pearls
quests.description: Expensive edition.

quests.name: Pure Processing Power
quests.description:
The Crafting CPU is a multiblock made up of at least one Crafting Storage (of any size), and is a cuboid shape that can contain Crafting Storages, Crafting Monitors, and Crafting Co-Processing Units.
The various Crafting Storages increase the complexity of the crafting chain that can be followed, with larger Crafting Storages increasing it more.

quests.name: Glowing Green
quests.description: Able to hold a maximum charge of 100,000, the Ender Capacitor (Enhanced) will serve you well.

quests.name: Moving time
quests.description:
The Dolly can pick up and move any block with an inventory, free of cost.
The Cardboard Box can move any block. Shift right-click to take the box off the block.

quests.name: Ultimate heat acquired!
quests.description: Upgrade your Basic Thermodynamic Conductors all the way to the Ultimate Tier!

quests.name: Boil your troubles away
quests.description:
Get ready to build the Thermoelectric Boiler multiblock and generate steam using one of the Heaters. 

You can either follow the description down below or watch this video turorial on how to build it. The build tutorial starts at 1:25 and ends at 3:00: https://youtu.be/WgLGOA9UztI?t=85

Description will be of the smallest possible Thermoelectric Boiler multiblock, a 3x3x4.

Make a 3x3 base/platform of the Boiler Casings.
Place a Superheating Element on the middleblock (when making a larger boiler, you can add more Superheating Elements to the layer, as long as they are touching each other side to side).
Place Boiler Casings around the Superheating Element. You can use Structual Glass instead of Boiler Casings anywhere but the corner/edge blocks.
Place a Pressure Disperser under the "roof" of the boiler, in this case it's on top of the Superheating Element, and surround it the same way as the Superheating Element, with either Boiler Casings or Structual Glass.
Add a final layer of Boiler Casings on top, making the multiblock 4 blocks tall, and replace 2 Boiler Casings with Boiler Valves, 1 touching the Superheating Element and 1 touching the Pressure Disperser. A flash of redstone particles surrounding the boiler multiblock will indicate that it has formed correctly and you can now access it UI by right+clicking anywhere on the multiblock.
Pump water into the valve touching the Superheating Element to fill up the boiler with water.
Use either a Fuelwood Heater or a Resistive Heater to add heat to the boiler. The heat cables can be attached anywhere on the boiler except on glass.
Wait for it to reach atleast 100?‹C and steam will be produced. The steam can be extracted through the valve touching the Pressure Disperser.

quests.name: 16^3 Spatial Component
quests.description: Stores up to a 16x16x16 area as a cell.

quests.name: Turn on the lights!
quests.description: Craft a Solar Neutron Activator and make the sun do all the work for you, well, not really but some of it! This machine is required to convert your Lithium into Tritium, one of the ingredients for DT-Fuel.

quests.name: *Teleports behind you*
quests.description: Says it all on the tin - its a reusable Ender Pearl. Make one.

quests.name: Candle
quests.description:
Right-clicking on an End Crystal in The End will convert an Inactive Ender Core into an Active Ender Core.
There are 3 different tiers of Ender Core. Craft a Basic.

quests.name: Mod your mod, with this mod
quests.description:
Ender Utilities is a very intricate mod. You should read the tooltips for the various items to learn more than this book says.
Oh, and remember to set your "Toggle Mode" key to something you'll remember.

quests.name: Room for more energy?
quests.description:
Can't fit all your POWAH in those pesky and small Energy Cubes and Cells? Well look no further, the Induction Matrix is just the thing for you! It can get as big as 18x18x18 and is highly configurable to fit your liking!

The smallest the Induction Matrix can be is 3x3x4 and it has to be a rectangular prism.

To build this, start off by placing a 3x3 base of Induction Casings anywhere you would like.
Now take your Basic Induction Cell and Basic Induction Provider and place one of them on the middle block and the other on top of that.
Now incase those 2 blocks with the rest of the Induction Casings and add the 2 Induction Ports on any face that is not a corner or edge block.
This will form the multiblock and a redstone particle effect will show you have done it correctly. The Induction Ports act as input and output for power and this can be toggled with the Configurator by shift+clicking a port. Green means input and red means output.

The Induction Matrix is highly configurable, meaning the bigger you make the multiblock, the more Induction Cells and Induction Providers you can fit in it, though at minimum you need 1 Induction Cell and 1 Induction Provider for the multiblock to form.
The Induction Cells increase the total energy capacity of the Induction Matrix and the Induction Providers increase the power output and input rate.
Both the Induction Cell and the Induction Provider have 4 variant. Basic, Advanced, Elite and Ultimate.
The better the tier the more effecient it will be.

You do not need to fill out the entire inner area with Induction Cells and Induction Providers though it is recommended to maximize its capability.

quests.name: Taste the Rainbow
quests.description:
Craft the Rainbow Generator!

The Generator will produce 25 million RF/t if you have all the other 16 generators running at the same time! This will only work if the same player places all the 16 different generators.

You will also need the Rainbow Generator running to be able to craft Rainbow Blocks.

quests.name: It activates autonomously
quests.description:
Craft a Mechanical User!

This block works like the Autonomous Activator from 1.7.10, such that it can simulate a player's Right/Left Click. You can configure a lot in its UI!

quests.name: Powered Purple
quests.description: Able to hold a maximum charge of 10,000, the Ender Capacitor (Basic) is your first step into Ender Utilities Power.

quests.name: Remember dirt stack #27?
quests.description: Can store and remember 54 stacks of items. When a remembered stack is depeleted, a ghost type of that item will appear, keeping the spot allocated to that item.

quests.name: Did someone say Tesseract?
quests.description:
Craft the Quantum Entangloporter!

It acts like a Tesseract, it feels like a Tesseract, so is it a Tesseract?

No! This one can transfer gasses too!

Can transfer energy/items/fluids/gasses over long distances from 1 Entangloporter to another on the same channel. It also has a distinct advantage over the Dimensional Transciever, as it can transport way more RF/tick. I recommend using this for pretty much every long-range project.

quests.name: Don't quarry about it!
quests.description:
Craft a Quantum Quarry and 6 Quantum Quarry Actuators to start mining in a hypothetical dimension that may have existed!

Place the Quantum Quarry anywhere and place the Quantum Quarry Actuators on each of the Quantum Quarry's 6 sides. Doing this will form the multiblock quarry.

Power can be input on any face of the multiblock and right+clicking it will open its UI.

20.000 RF is used per block mined and items are output to any inventory touching a face of the multiblock

In the UI you can add a filter to either whitelist or blacklist items. Items blacklisted or not whitelisted will still be mined and consume power but will be destroyed.

You can also add an enchanted book to the quarry i.e. Fortune or Silk Touch.

The last slot is for Biome Markers. These markers will dicide which biome the quarry mines in, so say you put in an Extreme Hills Biome Marker, you would get emeralds and so on.

The quarry can run without any of these addons but they are highly recommended!

quests.name: Grid Power to the max!
quests.description:
Craft the Dragon Egg Mill and place a Dragon Egg on top of it to potentially generate 5000 GP!

(This generator has been buffed and it generates 10 times the normal amount.)
